leaflet.candidateName: Maeve Tomlinson for Sutton and Cheam, Ross Hemingway for Carshalton and Wallington
leaflet.constituency: Sutton and Cheam, Carshalton and Wallington

messages.title: Ross says,
messages.content: There is an alternative to austerity, low wages and zero hour contracts. The Greens will introduce a new wealth tax on the top 1% and raise the minimum wage to a living wage of £10 an hour.

messages.title: Maeve says,
messages.content: The Greens will make sure big businesses pay their taxes and we will invest now in clean, green, renewable energy to create decent jobs and tackle climate change.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: We will end the creeping privatisation of the NHS, repeal the Health and Social Care Act 2012 and make the NHS a public health service again.
Whatever happened to the 'greenest government ever'? Our lives disappear in renewable energy, not dirty fossil fuels.
The Lib Dems broke their promise on tuition fees and saddled students with a mountain of debt. We will scrap tuition fees.
We will continue the fight to save this precious nature reserve from an expensive, polluting incinerator.
Homes are to live in, not assets for investors. We will abolish the bedroom tax and ensure everyone has an affordable place to live.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Let’s take on the tax dodgers
keyPolicies.policyDescription: It's morally wrong that the likes of Starbucks and Amazon are fleecing the tax system. We will close tax loopholes.

issues.economy: The Greens will make sure big businesses pay their taxes.
issues.education: The Lib Dems broke their promise on tuition fees and saddled students with a mountain of debt. We will scrap tuition fees.
issues.environment: We will continue the fight to save this precious nature reserve from an expensive, polluting incinerator.
issues.health: We will end the creeping privatisation of the NHS, repeal the Health and Social Care Act 2012 and make the NHS a public health service again.
issues.socialWelfare: We will abolish the bedroom tax and ensure everyone has an affordable place to live.

housing.content: Homes are to live in, not assets for investors. We will abolish the bedroom tax and ensure everyone has an affordable place to live.

contactInformation.address: Sutton Green Party, c/o Tower Cottage, Culvers Avenue, Carshalton, SM5 2BS

images.caption: Maeve Tomlinson for Sutton and Cheam, Ross Hemingway for Carshalton and Wallington with Jenny Jones (centre), Green Party member of the London Assembly.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Not registered to vote? Go to www.gov.uk/register-to-vote
